meanings.definition: A sturdy, muscular breed of dog with a wrinkled face and pushed-in nose.
meanings.sent1: The bulldog happily played in the park with its owner.
meanings.sent2: I saw a bulldog walking down the street with its owner.
meanings.sent3: The bulldog tried to hide its bone in a tiny flowerpot.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a bulldog's grip, never letting go of her goals.
meanings.sent5: The wrinkled face of the bulldog made it look wise beyond its years.

meanings.definition: A person who is aggressive or stubborn in behavior.
meanings.sent1: He's a real bulldog when it comes to negotiations.
meanings.sent2: The bulldog refused to back down from the argument.
meanings.sent3: The bulldog of the group always insists on choosing the restaurant.
meanings.sent4: Her boss was a bulldog, never accepting excuses for mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The bulldog's determination to win the game was unmatched.

meanings.sent1: She decided to bulldog her way through the difficult situation.
meanings.sent2: The team will bulldog their opponents in the upcoming match.
meanings.sent3: He tried to bulldog his fear of heights by climbing the tallest tree.
meanings.sent4: The candidate bulldogged his way into the lead with bold promises.
meanings.sent5: The detective bulldogged the suspect until the truth came out.
